SENT.plain: Transient global amnesia is generally regarded as a benign syndrome of probable vascular etiology
We describe a man who experienced a single episode of transient global amnesia and subsequently developed a progressive dominant hemispheric syndrome
Neuroradiologic investigations and the patient's subsequent death strongly suggest that his disease was due to a left temporal-parietal mass lesion
Although the syndrome is most often benign, such patients should be examined for mass lesions
